Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2016 11:10AM H2oCheetah wrote: @mustlove My husband gets to come with me. My mom is on her way!! @melissa normally I go to most appointments by myself spent pretty much this whole year in GYN office trying to figure out why I'm having issues down there cried in their arms as we talked about me having a hysterectomy to solve my issues. I went to my initial US by myself figured it'd be a 20 min appt and I'd be in and out I spent three hours there by myself part of it sitting in that lovely cape in a freezing room just wishing I had someone to lean on. I am totally happy that it worked out that he gets to go with me. The Drs did reassure me id be able to drive but at this point it's an emotional thing I feel like I've been through the ringer this year
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy time H2oCheetah H2oCheetah

Posts.Content: Dec 13, 2016 09:36AM - edited Dec 13, 2016 09:37AM by H2oCheetah Well my husband is actually off work this week so I thought great he'll be able to go with me and I scheduled it for Tuesday, MIL usually has Monday and Tuesday off, my MIL is in training this week so she isn't off today so I asked my mom and she's got physical therapy at a place 30-40 min away 1.5 hours before my appt so she's going to try and make it here so she can watch the kids and my husband can come with me, but I'm trying to accept the very real possibility of me going by myself. Thank you for the reassurance about them not just changing like that. I think I'm so concerned about that 1because I feel like it's doubled since Friday (but that could be my mind being overactive) but also I was concerned because of the speed at which things happened on Friday I went in expecting an ultrasound and left after having an US, mammogram and scheduled for biopsy it was just such a whirlwind. I don't think I've really processed everything. I cry sometimes, I'm strong sometimes, and other times I just try to ignore it.
Posts.Title: Waiting for biopsy time H2oCheetah H2oCheetah

Posts.Content: H2oCheetah wrote: I'm terrified. I have to go to my biopsy by myself and that's such a lonely thought. Part of me is scared they're going to change their minds and want to put me out to take the whole mass (I feel like it's grown significantly since Friday). I only have to wait three more hours before I leave but that feels like a lifetime away. I made myself an outfit for today but the words ended up pulling to the wrong side and now I'm not as excited about itðŸ˜” Oh well. I will make it through today but for now I need to convince myself to eat Log in to post a reply
